I like the idea, but they shouldn't be overpowered. If they are more useful than an iron golem, (Which while not the best defender, it helps to incentivize building and to work on the village.) than what is the point of defending a town if the villagers do it for them.

they shouldnt have aimbot like the skeleton

and the warriors should have little attack damage because there will be alot of them
I agree. The villagers would be nice because iron golems often are worn down by mobs. This would make hero of the village a little too easy but it's a good idea overall.

This would be a great way to troll others. I like this idea.
like this idea. i think put gunpowder into furnance should also able to blew up.
I had the exact same idea. I really like this idea and, yes, this makes a lot of sense. Slow falling should muffle your steps and should affect how the Warden detects the player.

I think this make a lot of sense. Slow falling already stops people from destroying crops, so it would make sense that the landing is also soft enough to where you do not make much or any noise. It could make it so the Warden still detects you if you get close enough since mobs can still detect you if you are close enough with invisibility, at least with armor. However, I feel like this should not be the case, as the player does a lot of other actions that produce sound. I think slow falling should fully block all sound from sneaking, walking, sprinting, and jumping. Gliding with the elytra too if that makes sound. Slow falling would not block sounds from things like eating and mining, so you still have to be very careful. If slow falling made all running and jumping fully undetectable, the player often does a lot more than just these actions, so it would still be balanced. This could even apply to sculk sensors, making entrances that require slow falling to get through easily while performing a certain action at some point possible. You could make entire maps around this feature, as being able to walk, jump, and sprint past sculk sensors but still being able to activate them by doing something like eating of punching a wall opens up a lot of possibilities. Finally, this adds a reason to actually carry slow falling instead of just using an elytra or water bucket. With the ability to stack potions in the future combat update, this would make players want to carry slow falling.

Had the same idea just now and looked to see you already did so yeah. Agree that it makes perfect sense to have slow fall cancel out vibrations from movement but not eating or mining. Love the idea of gliding through the air over a warden from the top of a cave to some structure in the deep dark to grab loot and having it suddenly turn on you as it feels the vibrations only when you open the chest
This is a great idea
I agree. Maybe it could also hold water in it like a cauldron, but you're able to transport it in your inventory.

Nice idea!

Upsides:

1. Cool name.

2. Chestplates and leggings could use more enchantments. 

Downsides:

1. Might be unlikely to be added b/c this can be pretty much be accomplished by just... wearing golden armor. Having to wear weak armor is a good trade-off for Piglin non-aggression; if you can bypass this altogether, the golden armor requirement feels a bit redundant late-game. Mitigated by the fact that it only grants you a chance to work.

2. Perhaps not very intuitive when implemented. For example, does the chance for the deceptive effect to be applied reroll every time the Piglins look at you? 

Recommendations:

1. Level IV-V seems to be reserved for very powerful and game-changing enchantments like sharpness, power, and efficiency. Maybe a maximum level of 2 or 3 would be better? 

2. Should be an enchantment obtainable only by bartering since it's a purely nether-related enchantment.

I agree. This problem has been around since version 1.7 or earlier and makes it permanently impossible to manage or grow a dark oak biome in the long run. All other trees drop more saplings than you need to plant that particular tree. This problem really needs to be resolved.

This really should be getting more attention. Anyone who farms every tree type knows that dark oak saplings often don't drop at a high enough rate to replace trees. Cherry trees have a crazy high rate, so I don't see a reason not to increase the rate for dark oak.
Still an issue as of 1.21.10 Java. Trying to start a dark oak farm near base and I am losing saplings overtime due to some trees dropping only 3 or 2.

I understand your point but since on our planet, there is gold underground, decreasing the spawn rate seems a lot more logical to me. I expect the Nether Update to bring a lot more uses to gold, to it's value will probably increase and the rarity even increases this point.

One other thing that would be interesting to see would be armor toughness increased on golden armor pieces, similar to diamond armor's armor toughness, yet still having the lower protection that gold armor gives

The problem is the piglin bodyguards will attack you if the armor breaks and the faberable will not let you add defense so thatâ€™s the problem with it I also think that itâ€™s silly that you would need to pieces of gold armor to trade with Piglins

I love this idea so much, & I was thinking of a similar idea when I saw that many players, especially speed-runners, were claiming that Minecraft has too much RNG, & that it really takes a hit on speedrunners. It should be more about skill than complete randomness. This was especially frustrating for players when ender pearl trades were nerfed. So by having a mechanic of having better barter luck when wearing more gold armor, it not only makes gold armor a ton more useful, but it brings skill to this system that many more will enjoy. Wearing no gold but distracting a piglin by bartering should bring the same luck as it currently is, 1 gold piece would bring slightly more luck, but 2-4 pieces would bring a lot more luck, especially maybe even extra quantities of certain trades too. With this, people would consider more on whether they want to try to mine for more gold or to find a bastion.

Like I hinted from my other comment, for your royalty idea, I think you should still be able to barter with piglins no matter if you have gold armor or not. I really like the mechanic of being able to distract piglins with bartering as we currently have it right now.
This is a really good idea, but I think that there shouldn't be an enchantment for this. This idea can also explain many work-related things...

I think this is a great idea but I feel it needs the piglins to perhaps be more dynamic in the way they act like them still following you for a while despite your armor breaking or all having different levels of respect for the player
What about those players that play Minecraft mute?

I like this idea, but we shouldn't disable subtitles. Some players depend on them to understand what's going on (people who are actually deaf in real life). Instead of muting the game's audio, why not have an intense ringing that disorients the player?

The only problem with what I proposed is that it could hinder people who have sensory issues.

365668671752 Talking about removing subtitles. Temporarily hiding the subtitles hinders their ability to 'hear' in a way as removing the audio for people who can hear would do the same thing. Deaf people don't need ears to see what is going on. Although I do like the idea that instead of muting everything, there should be a ringing sound in the background that fades in and/or out.

This is an excellent idea! In fact, I only found this one because I thought of it myself. However, like blindness, the audio should just be diminished a certain amount depending on the level of the status effect. Level 255 should be completely deaf.
